paper_abstract: Cavenagh, Donovan and Drapal (2005) gave a construction for 3-homogeneous latin bitrades which was proved by Cavenagh (2006) to give every 3-homogeneous latin bitrade. A corollary is that every 3-homogenous latin bitrade may be partitioned into three disjoint transversals. Using a permutation representation for latin bitrades developed by Drapal, we provide a shorter proof of these results, and then give a construction for a family of separated 4-homogeneous latin bitrades.
paper_title: Permutation representation of 3 and 4-homogenous latin bitrades
